title: Anxiety
description: Learning to manage anxiety and develop self-regulation skills.
welcomeMessage: Take control of your anxiety. Master techniques for managing anxious thoughts and restoring inner calm.

cards.introduction: Anxiety often starts with physical sensations. Let's learn to recognize them.
questions: What physical sensations do you experience when anxious?
Where in your body do you feel tension?
cards.recommendation: Record physical anxiety symptoms throughout the week. Why: helps track patterns and early signals.
cards.mechanism: Increased awareness of bodily anxiety manifestations.

cards.introduction: Breathing is our main tool for calming the nervous system.
questions: How do you breathe when anxious?
What happens to your breathing in calm moments?
cards.recommendation: Practice the '4-7-8' technique: inhale for 4 counts, hold for 7, exhale for 8. Why: activates the parasympathetic nervous system.
cards.mechanism: Activation of the parasympathetic nervous system.

cards.introduction: Anxious thoughts often catastrophize the future. Time to stop them.
questions: What anxious thoughts most often run through your head?
How realistic is the probability of what you're anxious about?
cards.recommendation: Divide anxious thoughts into 'facts' and 'interpretations'. Work only with facts. Why: reduces catastrophizing.
